text: Changing Frequent Flyer Numbers after Booking #1 Original Poster Join Date: Aug 2010 Location: London Programs: BA Silver, Sky Team Silver, Star Alliance Silver Posts: 160 Changing Frequent Flyer Numbers after Booking I have eight active bookings currently on British Airways, and have recently been informed that I will be transferred to the United States in July 2024. There are still some decent redemptions available with Avios on AA and AS nonstops within the Americas. And it might be easier for you to obtain/retain status with BAEC than AAdvantage -- depending on your flying patterns. Last edited by guv1976; Oct 18, 2023 at 4:05 pm #3 Join Date: Apr 2012 Location: STL Programs: AA Lifetime Platinum Posts: 594 Call BA or use the chat feature and ask them to change it. But remember that Avios can be very useful in the US for internal flights on AA and Alaska, and One World partners internationally. I find it very useful to have a stash of Avios and AA miles because sometimes there are better options with one over another. With that said as a US resident there are more opportunities to acquire BA miles than AA miles (after you have exhausted the Citi and Barclays credit card bonuses). Also as a BA silver/One World Sapphire (or higher) I think you get access to domestic AA lounges which you wonâ€™t if you qualify for One World Sapphire via AA. #4 Original Poster Join Date: Aug 2010 Location: London Programs: BA Silver, Sky Team Silver, Star Alliance Silver Posts: 160 It is possible, by using the "Manage My Booking" function at finnair.com -- or some other oneworld carrier websites -- to remove your BAEC number from all the bookings.
